name: White Chocolate Cranberry Pumpkin Muffins
author: CelticMommy
summary: These spicy muffins are moist and full of flavor. The cranberry perfectly complements the pumpkin flavor while hints of orange keep the muffins tasting light. The white chocolate chips are optional if you want to make these more of a yummy dessert. The perfect fall treat!
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease 3 muffin pans or line with muffin wrappers
Mix flour, white sugar, salt, baking soda, and allspice together in a bowl
Whisk eggs in a separate large bowl
Add vegetable oil, pumpkin, orange juice, vanilla extract to eggs; whisk until smooth
Stir flour mixture into pumpkin mixture until just combined; fold in white chocolate chips and cranberries
Pour batter into the prepared muffin cups
Sprinkle each muffin with brown sugar
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean, about 25 minutes
